title: random huge lag spikes
body: just wondering if anyone else gets massive lag spikes at random times? it ranges from 200-3000ping lasts a few mins some games it doesnt do it but most of the time it does. top of the line pc but running adsl1 atm waiting for nbn to be installed here.

replies.body: im with iinet bro, thanks for ur reply, they only have ads1 here no ads2 line connected (tried all companys) all around our area have nbn then theres like 3-4 streets like mine that dont!

Please use the "Reply" feature of the boards to reply to people, otherwise they won't get notification of it!

Anyway, the type of connection you need to play League isn't the issue here. Switching from ADSL to ADSL2 won't do anything, because the difference they have on speed for gaming is negligible. I mean, I play on a 2G wireless connection with ~50ms ping. League isn't that data intensive at all.

NBN wouldn't make any difference for something as low data intensive as this, either. What I'm thinking is that it might be the ISP itself (iiNet is still relatively new) or it could be a separate reason on your computer itself. Have you looked over [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)?

Whatever you decide to do, best of luck with it.
i'll lend my voice to this. getting the same thing, wasn't an issue until a few days ago and is really affecting play.

What ISP are you with? Some companies will advertise ADSL as if it's the ultimate connection speed (which it is, for the most part) and then give you a shoddy connection to it, causing things like this to happen.

Of course, it could be because of something else but I'd like to go through this one at a time.
